page.title: 17LOCAL HISTORY
page.content: {LOCAL HISTORY} The working horses were the main asset of the farm before the advent of the tractor.Corn was sown and thrashed by hand and a weekly visit made to the local mill.The sheaves of corn gave the countryside quite a different aspect from nowadays. The farm employed two workers who earned 10-12 shillings a week and had a house provided.Today Mr.Anstey's son runs the farm and only hires contract labour at busy times.In the past Mr.Anstey knew ninety per cent of the community,so help was always at hand from a neighbour 'unlike today'.Home life too was very different.Cooking was on an open fire.Every farm had a pig sty and always had two or three sides of bacon hanging.Food was salted for preservation and butter,milk and cheese all produced on the farm.
